column18: 07/04/2017: Assailants set fire to the Lusaka City Market in Lusaka, Zambia. There were no reported casualties, but the market was significantly damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the United Party for National Development (UPND).
column64: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out with the intention of damaging the economy.
column108: A market was damaged in this attack.
column125: Security forces also claimed to carry out the arson on the marketplace, stating that they were angry with the ruling party, the Patriotic Front (PF).
column126: \\"\"Declaration of near-state of emergency in Zambia likely to drive further violent unrests and disrupt ground transportation"
column129: 2017.\",\"\"\"Zambian leader Lungu warns of 'sabotage' after fire razes biggest market"

column18: 07/09/2017: Assailants threw three incendiary devices at the Daily Nation newspaper office in Lusaka, Zambia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
column97: Three petrol bombs were used in the attack.
column126: \\"\"Top news items in major Zambian media outlets"
